sc_api_tools.annotation_readers.datumaro_annotation_reader package

Submodules

sc_api_tools.annotation_readers.datumaro_annotation_reader.datumaro_annotation_reader module

class sc_api_tools.annotation_readers.datumaro_annotation_reader.datumaro_annotation_reader.DatumAnnotationReader(base_data_folder: str, annotation_format: str, task_type: Union[sc_api_tools.data_models.enums.task_type.TaskType, str] = TaskType.DETECTION)

Bases: sc_api_tools.annotation_readers.base_annotation_reader.AnnotationReader

Class to read annotations using datumaro

prepare_and_set_dataset(task_type: Union[sc_api_tools.data_models.enums.task_type.TaskType, str])

Prepares a dataset for uploading annotations for a certain task_type

Returns

convert_labels_to_segmentation_names() → None

This method converts the label names in a dataset to ‘*_shape`, where * is the original label name. It can be used to generate unique label names for the segmentation task in a detection_to_segmentation project

get_all_label_names() → List[str]

Retrieves the list of labels names from a datumaro dataset

property datum_label_map: Dict[int, str]
Returns

Dictionary mapping the datumaro label id to the label name

override_label_map(new_label_map: Dict[int, str])

Overrides the label map defined in the datumaro dataset

Returns

reset_label_map()

Resets the label map back to the original one from the datumaro dataset

Returns

get_all_image_names() → List[str]

Returns a list of image names in the dataset

Returns

get_data(filename: str, label_name_to_id_mapping: dict, preserve_shape_for_global_labels: bool = False) → List[sc_api_tools.data_models.annotations.Annotation]

Get annotation data for a certain filename

property applied_filters: List[Dict[str, Union[str, List[str]]]]

Returns a list of dictionaries representing the filter settings that have been applied to the dataset, if any.

Dictionaries in this list contain two keys: - ‘labels’ – List of label names which has been filtered on - ‘criterion’ – String representing the criterion that has been used in the

filtering. Can be ‘OR’, ‘AND’, ‘XOR’ or ‘NOT’.

Returns

List of filter settings that have been applied to the dataset. Returns an empty list if no filters have been applied.

filter_dataset(labels: Sequence[str], criterion='OR') → None

Retain only those items with annotations in the list of labels passed.

Param

labels List of labels to filter on

Param

criterion Filter criterion, currently “OR” or “AND” are implemented

group_labels(labels_to_group: List[str], group_name: str) → None

Group multiple labels into one. Grouping converts the list of labels into one single label named group_name.

This method does not return anything, but instead overrides the label map for the datamaro dataset to account for the grouping.

Parameters

  • labels_to_group – List of labels names that should be grouped together

  • group_name – Name of the resulting label

Returns

get_annotation_stats() → Dict[str, Dict[str, int]]

Returns the object and image counts per label in the dataset.

Returns

Dictionary containing label names as keys, and as values: - n_images: Number of images containing this label - n_objects: Number of independent objects with this label

filter_items_by_labels(labels: Sequence[str], criterion='OR') → None

Retain only those items with annotations in the list of labels passed.

Parameters

  • labels – List of labels to filter on

  • criterion – Filter criterion, currently “OR”, “NOT”, “AND” and “XOR” are implemented
